de.cau.lps.debugger.program

Class DebuggerState

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.cau.lps.debugger.program.DebuggerState

  • public class DebuggerState
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps the state of the Debugger, i.e. the current position, the call stack etc.
    Author:
    Thomas Ulrich

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DebuggerState()
      Initializes a new instance of the DebuggerState class.
      DebuggerState(DebuggerState other)
      Initializes a new instance of the DebuggerState class, using another DebuggerState as a blueprint, copying its state.

        public void setPosition(Position newPosition)
        Informs the debugger of the new position within the source code.
        Parameters:

      • isAutoStep

        public boolean isAutoStep()
        Returns the value of the autoStep flag.
        Returns:
        True if the debugger auto-acknowledges messages from the runtime, otherwise false.

      • setAutoStep

        public void setAutoStep(boolean autoStep)
        Sets the autoStep flag, i.e. enabling or disabling auto stepping.
        Parameters:
        autoStep - True if auto stepping should be enabled, false if it should be disabled.

      • isStepOverNextCall

        public boolean isStepOverNextCall()
        Returns the value of the stepOverNextCall flag.
        Returns:
        True if debugger is supposed to step over next call, otherwise false.

      • setStepOverNextCall

        public void setStepOverNextCall(boolean stepOverNextCall)
        Sets the stepOverNextCall flag.
        Parameters:
        stepOverNextCall - True if next call should be stepped over, false if not.

      • getTopMostCallOptions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getTopMostCallOptions()
        Gets the Map of options for the topmost call or an empty map if call stack is empty.
        Returns:
        A Map of String keys and String values.

      • getLocalScopeIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getLocalScopeIdentifier()
        Gets the identifier of the current scope.
        Returns:
        The current scope identifier.
